newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to be firm.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool prices expected to be firm.

text.p: Australian wool prices for medium to broad wools and stylish superfine clips are expected to remain firm this week, Wesfarmers Dalgety Ltd said in its weekly market preview.
Sales this week are in Sydney, Geelong and Fremantle, with about 88,700 bales on offer.

In Sydney, the offering consists of predominantly good to best topmaking, western style wools, including a number of spinner types. In Geelong, a small but good offering of best topmaking styles is expected with a solid proportion of spinners and some very good lambs wool.
In Fremantle, the bales are mainly good topmaking style that were previously withheld.
The eastern market indicator fell by six cents to 592 cents a kg clean, while the western market indicator rose by one cent to 573 cents a kg clean.
Wesfarmers said the market is expected to remain around current levels.

"There is the possibility of slight weakness in the 19 to 22 micron category due to the continuing good supply of these types with more designated fine wool sales this week," Wesfarmers said. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
